package.name: Auth_HTTP
package.description: The PEAR::Auth_HTTP class provides methods for creating an HTTP authentication system using PHP, that is similar to Apache's realm-based .htaccess authentication.

release.notes: - Fixed a bug #2380: constractor couldn't handle non-array option. - The first stable release with HTTP Digest Authenthication support.
- Fixed a bug #2061 (importglobalvariable() was removed in Auth 1.3.0r2.) - now Auth_HTTP requires Auth >= 1.3.0r2.
- Fixed a bug #1634 (URI parameter was handled incorrectry.)

- Added _sessionName which fixes a major issue with realm sharing. - Added sessionSharing option to use unique session id. Currently, this option is set to true by default to maintain backward compatibility. - Added setOption and getOption to set/get option value. - Starting with this release, HTTP Digest Authentication (RFC2617) is experimentally supported. The code for HTTP Digest Authentication is originally developed by Tom Pike.

Starting with this release, the code will not be placed in Auth_HTTP/Auth_HTTP.php anymore. Instead Auth/HTTP.php is used, which conforms to the PEAR standards.
In order to make use of the new version, you will need to change your scripts to include the file at the new location! The old version in Auth_HTTP/Auth_HTTP.php will not be removed when upgrading.
Other changes:
* If it is possible, the session ID will be chosen based on the user's authentication credentials. (Patch by: Marko Karppinen) * Cleaned up internal variable usage. (Patch by: Brad Bulger)
This is the initial independent release of the Auth_HTTP package.
